macro.para: This macro expands to a where the in expr have been replaced by arguments from __VA_ARGS__ or curried. All uses of the operator are also replaced.

As many as there are arguments in __VA_ARGS__ are replaced by those arguments, and the remaining are shifted down. For example, if E is a in terms of _0, _1, and _2, then...
(E, X)
...results in a with _0 replaced by X, _1 replaced by _0, and _2 replaced by _1. Further, if two arguments are applied
(E, X, Y)
...the resulting has _0 replaced by X, _1 replaced by Y, and _2 replaced by _0.
